result.execSummary:
The defendant TaCarl V Jackson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin(>10-50g), a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)3.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concur to 15CF544.  Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted. $92 VW surcharge paid in full from bond.
Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with MA and AT.
Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.
